website_summaries.verdict: A unique cart won't work for everyone, but provides both a portable garden tool compartment and handy seat for those who can use it.
pros: Not only does the Garden Hopper offer space for several garden tools and supplies, but it doubles as a seat for gardeners as they work
cons: Not likely to accommodate those weighing more than 100 pounds
Doesn't roll very well over rough ground
Not ideal for transporting large items

customer_reviews.title: Makes gardening easier and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: i recommend this, it's perfect for the our box garden, "eases bending over back pain" easy to scoot left and right while sitting and working harvest,
customer_reviews.author: Terry Trout

customer_reviews.title: Not Made for Adults Weighting Over 230 Pounds.
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 230 pounds. The product description for the item said maximum weight "250 pounds". However when I sit on this, the wheels bend upward and rub across the bottom of the unit, causing friction and making it very difficult to move. The plastic hollow wheels on this are very thin and flimsy, and the axle is very thin. I imagine for someone weighing less than 180 pounds this would be an ideal product, If you are my weight or over, this unit will not support your weight properly.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Beck

customer_reviews.title: this 'hopper" would make a great children's toy
customer_reviews.text: this 'hopper" would make a great children's toy. or a great gardening cart/seat for anyone that weighed less than probably 150 lbs. I'm about 203, and it claims it can handle that much weight, but believe me, it won't. the wheels aren't really wheels, they are more like "cups' - hard to describe, but in reality they only have and "top" and a "side" making up the wheel. they are hollow, flimsy, and collapse very easily, as well as scrape the "body" when carrying weight. hope this makes sense. do not buy if you weight more than about 150. you will be unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen E. Blalack

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This thing was sturdy enough to sit on. It did not, however roll when you wanted it to, and then rolled right out from under me twice to where I fell and hurt my back, falling backwards on a flagstone path. The whole reason I bought it was too keep from having to bend over and strain my back. This just made everything worse ands now I can't garden at all.The thing needs a brake. I'm extremely unhappy with it. I would not recommend it to anyone. Alas, too late to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Water Captured in Base: Quick Fix
customer_reviews.text: I like my Garden Hopper very much, but there is one real flaw. I often leave my Hopper outside in warm months, near where I need to work. I quickly learned that, when it rains, water collects in the cavity below the bench. No problem, I figured—just flip it upside down when not in use. But then I discovered water somehow seeps inside the vacu-formed base and has no way to drain. Aargh! My very handy husband solved the problem by drilling 3 drain holes in the bottom of the unit (see photo). Problem solved! Still, it would be far preferable for the company to address this issue during the manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.author: JAG in Southern Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Too big to return
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this but found it hard to maneuver and sometimes difficult to stand up without compromising a feeling of it staying put and not causing me to trip . Doesn’t roll smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Liebert

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and not unlike a kid's toy- so ignore the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing has garnered me more abuse- then acceptance and appreciation- than this item. As a 50+ y/o human that works in the yard constantly, I got some good-natured ribbing from my significant other and neighbors.. then came the "Hey, so does that help keep your back from killing you the next day?" and the inevitable "I need one of those"! Sturdy and not unlike a kid's toy- so ignore the initial mockery, admit you aren't 20 anymore and put a few beers on ice in the compartment underneath and skip the Advil the next day!
customer_reviews.author: Kundalini Express

customer_reviews.title: helps avoid back pain in the garden
customer_reviews.text: No assembly required, reasonably light weight, but stable, my garden is a bit uneven so I have to pick it up and move it sometimes rather than roll it, but it works well for harvesting green beans, or other crops that require a lot of bending and reaching. I plan to use it on my currant bush next year, which was my nemesis last season. I leave it outdoors, the bottom collects a bit of rain and the top collects dew, a quick wipe dries the seat, I will take it in for the cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: I. Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Wheels get pinched when using it and it won't roll!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my previous garden hopper gave out after about 20 years of use. It is rated for 250 lbs. I weigh about 190 lbs. When trying to use it in my garage to move around, the wheels get pinched and it does not roll. You have to get up and move the hopper then sit again. I called the company and they said others have complained about the issue as well and there is no resolution. Its going back...sad...new products don't work as good as the old ones..
customer_reviews.author: fanofsteel

customer_reviews.title: Everyone could benefit from one of these
customer_reviews.text: I use it everywhere. Cleaning out bottom shelves and drawers in fridge, dressers. I get serious leg cramps and no longer squat down to do anything which in itself puts a cramp in things :) I have an older Grasshopper that I have used for over forty years mostly outdoors. When I started bringing it inside I realized how dirty it was but is as good as new. Also this new one is a better design. The old one has a closed compartment and holds water if it gets wet. Some things just keep getting better. Thank goodness.
customer_reviews.author: rrice

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PURCHASE  :))
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this little roly-poly Garden Wheeler!! I have lower back problems and severe arthritis, and this little baby helps me SO MUCH!! No more painful bending from the waist or knees, limiting my garden time. Plus, it's made by Step 2, which told me it was a quality product. There's even a space for a water bottle or a canned beverage.. so cool! Plenty of room under the seat for tools, gloves, etc. I would definitely recommend this - a fantastic gift for gardener friends, too.
customer_reviews.author: ac3013

customer_reviews.title: Love my little cart!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE my cart! I am a 'larger' senior woman and it has held up well. There's no handle on the ends for pulling it along. My gardens are lumpy and bumpy, and also muddy and soft. The cart doesn't just roll along on some sidewalk next to a garden bed, so I've had to wrap a hunk of rope around one end. The length of area inside it is slightly short for standard sized trowel etc. The cup/water bottle holder is flakey. A slight bump or tilt and the water bottle falls out. Even with those issues, this thing has made it possible for me to keep gardening at 65 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Deedle

customer_reviews.title: Love My Scuttlebutt
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough how much I love this product. I call it my Scuttlebutt and I use it for everything - painting my lower cabinets, cleaning the grout on my kitchen tiles, planting flowers, painting low walls, placing stone borders around my walkway... the list goes on. The Scuttlebutt is durable and lightweight, which is great for carrying it all over the house and yard. If you're going to be on it for a while, I recommend a cushion because the hard plastic will make your butt hurt. Highly recommend - especially for people who don't feel like getting down on the floor and would rather sit
customer_reviews.author: Luma

customer_reviews.title: Qulity
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS CART. WHEELS RUB AGAINST BODY HOUSING AND IT WONT ROLL. GARBAGE
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Hamerton

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Those are not real Wheels. They are plastic and open on the backside so you can't wheel them through grass or dirt because they will dig in. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverFreddiesGirl

customer_reviews.title: The Hopper is practical, but fun, because it looks like a toy and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone comments about the Garden Hopper, like "How cute!" Attractive green color. The hopper is sturdy, with wide, sturdy tires. Plenty of room for gardening tools. I highly recommend the Hopper.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine H. Gervais

customer_reviews.title: I wish this had handles
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Beware, the hole for the drink is small and would not fit my washable water bottle. I have fun with the product when weeding/working on concrete, but "off road" in the garden I find myself straddling the thing (lots of weeds right now) and can't move it forward without getting up and manually moving it. A handle on the end would easily help this as there is nothing I can find on the unit itself to propel myself on.
customer_reviews.author: CAC

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Back and Neck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little cart because I needed some relief from bending over in the garden. I weigh almost 250 pounds and am 6'6" tall, so it had to be sturdy, This is a tough little cart and really handy opening for gloves and garden tools. Its still hanging in after traveling most of my backyard doing week pulling with me. Only a 4 for maneuverability because it only goes in a straight line. No turns unless you pick it up and turn it.
customer_reviews.author: Golfing Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight but Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: “Step2 Garden Hopper” is a light weight, easy to carry, rolling stool with a carryall under the seat. The height is good – not too low to get up from and rolls along great on concrete. The only down side that I can find is that the wheels are made out of plastic and doesn’t roll very well on gravel. Overall, this little garden stool works for me and fills my needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Seniors can use this to keep gardening!
customer_reviews.text: I have an arthritic knee and weeding or doing close to the ground work is difficult for me. This is a perfect height for me to get up/down. I keep my gardening tools and gloves in the area under the seat and the cup holder is perfect! I can put my iced drink (water, coffee or tea) in a 16 oz holder an stay out and I don't worry about forgetting my drink or knocking it over. I live in AZ and keeping hydrated is important. I can see how a kid would enjoy rolling around on the patio too, but for me this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Aly Cline

customer_reviews.title: Like a kids tough toy but for adults!!
customer_reviews.text: First this was bought for my 71 year old housemate. She weighs 95 pounds so this was perfect for her. She scoots around the backyard and has no problem picking it up by the handle. She put lots of small garden tools inside and she really likes it. So, I weigh 190 lbs and sat on it once to see if it could hold my weight. It did but would not recommend this for anyone over 150 pounds. It's built just like a tough outdoor kids toy so that part is cool and funny. I recommend for small , lightweight people, fat people stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for weeding
customer_reviews.text: This stool is wonderful. I have a disability and can’t bend over or kneel and this is the perfect height to sit and weed. I’m 5’6” and sit with one leg bent normally and the other leg straight out to the side. Great area to put small hand shovel/tools under the seat. Wheels roll well on grass when sitting but VERY easily on concrete so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for gardening
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mother for her birthday and she loved it! She likes to do light gardening/weeding and had mentioned it was getting harder for her to bend over or get up and down. As an added bonus, my kiddos like to go over and help her garden so they can scoot around the yard! The lid doesn't open, which I had read in reviews. It's not an issue, you can put tools in and out of the side, just something to be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: O & J Mom

customer_reviews.title: Really Cute!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for a Silent Auction item for a fundraiser. I put all kinds of gardening tools with it & it was just too cute! The only thing that I found disappointing was that in the picture it looked like the seat would open up like a lid and you could get at the tools or whatever was inside the storage area. This is not the case, yes it is sturdy to sit on and roll around while gardening but as I said I thought the lid would pop up
customer_reviews.author: noreen chervinski

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it !!!
customer_reviews.text: My mother wore out her old hopper, and we picked this one out to replace it. It is well-built and sturdy. Note that the top does not come off, which in my opinion is good because it adds to the sturdiness and stability when she sits on it. Bottom line is my mom loves it, and that's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: JaggedOne

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the older ones
customer_reviews.text: My mother has an older version of this and it has better wheels. Mine are like half of one of her wheels, exactly like the cut a wheel in half. The old ones are fully enclosed and mine are open. Also, the older one seems sturdier than mine. It still meets the purpose but it is disappointing when a company cuts quality like this. The older product is definitely superior.
customer_reviews.author: AK transplant

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy- not suitable for a child
customer_reviews.text: Description says its rated for 250lbs. Just received it. I weigh 235lb. I sat on it and could feel the wheels immediately rub to green body. I had my wife who weighs about 130lb sit on it. Had they same problem. Couldn't roll it indoors without the wheels scraping the green body. You can see the wheels are very wobbly and the plastic body is made of VERY thin materials. I have returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A.

customer_reviews.title: THE LOOK IS DECEIVING
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made sturdy garden buddy. Unfortunately it has no handle to pull it and the top doesn't come off making it difficult to place odd size garden utensils, bags of dirt etc. This was a gift for my mom. She is an avid gardener and 91 years young The missing features are essential for her. I assumed these features were basic parts of the Hopper. I will have to return it. I recommend that if you are interested in purchasing this you check to see that it has all the features you want. The look of it is deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: No assembly required!
customer_reviews.text: There is something beautiful about opening a box and finding the product pre-assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Shootmore

customer_reviews.title: A Lot Smaller Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after reading most of the Reviews. Honestly, I am a bit disappointed in the size but for the price I guess I shouldn't have expected more. I really don't think it's going to be as useful as I was hoping garden-wise. More than likely, it will become a scoot around ride for the grandkids. It does seem to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Leona Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be better
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted one of these for 3 years and the big box stores either ran out quickly or never ordered them. Amazon delivered in days and I’m excited to use this to garden with less pain and more joy. It’s very sturdy, has great storage, and the wheels are just the right size to smoothly navigate garden rows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars for this garden and home workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for working in the garden. But I also use it to clean the baseboards prior to painting interior walls, and to cut in and roll the lower area of the walls. Its size and shape makes it easy to maneuver and change direction without having to continually get up to reposition. For gardening, tools can be put into the bin. For cleaning and painting, the bin conveniently holds a roll of paper towels to be pulled as needed. Currently not in production, but I wish Step2 would re-start manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Handy Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of gardening and my trusty stool I've used finally broke, so after reading various review I order this product. So far it works just fine, it is light weight and sturdy. It's easy to move around, and you have a little storage under seat. The only thing that would have made it better is to have the seat lift up to access the storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Third party seller unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for elderly mom who couldn't use it because it sits too low, isn't maneuverable and has no handles to help her get up. Only took out of box and never used it. Tried contacting seller, TruValue Hardware, 3 times to return it. I understand not every seller will take returns, but I couldn't even get a response. Very frustrating. I ended up buying a scooter that steers, has a seat that turns and has handles. The Garden Hopper seems more like a toy than a functional tool.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn J. Thomason

customer_reviews.title: "My bad" is not an apology
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little hopper and used every time I work in the yard which is at least twice a week. It's light enough to place tools, gloves, etc., into and lift over the fence when I'm too lazy to walk to the gate. I also found it useful inside the house when I worked on some low shelves in the living room. Some mud was on the wheels which got on the wood floors, which my gf pointed out. This is when I learned that "my bad" is not an apology.
customer_reviews.author: ljb63

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I liked the simplicity of this tool and the price for what I was getting. The bottle holder is a little small, but I have one water bottle that fits in it. I like the storage beneath for my tools that I use often. I was worried it wouldn't roll over the playground fiber I have in my walkways, but it does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stroup

customer_reviews.title: Everyone uses it
customer_reviews.text: Not just good for my old 66 yr old bones but my 11 yr old granddaughter loves to sit on it while pulling weeds from the lawn. And the 4 yr old just likes to take it for a spin. I use it when I'm tending my raised garden. The garden is 18" high and the seat is the right height. I also carry it with me through our small vineyard and sit to tie up vines and check weeds and drip fittings. Because the top is NOT on a hinge to easily open and close, I find I keep my tools in pockets on my apron and not inside the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Coach V

customer_reviews.title: Too high
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be good for ground work like weeding but that has you bending way down. So tools go in there nice and my drink. Nice seat for a rest or when my plants grow a need some trimming it should work better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy rolling  little gardening seat.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little gardening seat but rolls VERY quickly on concrete driveway. Just fine if you stay on the lawn. I have beds that come up to my driveway that I want to work in but I am mobility challenged and I am fearful of rolling away on the concrete.
customer_reviews.author: JHSTX

customer_reviews.title: Great product -- would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: It's great. It's my second one. I use it for my gardening as I can't stand/bend over for long periods and I also use it for painting baseboards and taping them as well. The fact that it rolls along the floor by the wall allows me to run a continuous strip of tape and also painting without getting up to move it. My grandson loves it too as I can give him rides on it. My daughter bought the first one for my birthday several years ago and I have used it ever since. Looks like new (except for a couple of paint spots).
customer_reviews.author: K. Strouse

customer_reviews.title: This is fabulous- I was kneeling on mulch and uneven ...
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous- I was kneeling on mulch and uneven areas causing a lot of pain. Now, I just roll from place to place.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Inside the house
customer_reviews.text: I am using this inside the house to clean the lower part of paneling cabinets, and furniture. It is as good for bad knees inside as it is outside.
customer_reviews.author: rtb159

customer_reviews.title: Im really fat and it held up just fine
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. I do hate when someone tells me I hv a drink holder- especially on something i'll b sweating and thirsty while i'm using it- and it'll hold a 16oz oz bottle of water. So that was disappointing. Also the dugout to "store and carry" things is not what u might assume. Again, they never said that. U just kind of assume. It doesn't say they DON'T hv it. So whatever u "store and carry" has to fit into that opening. The top is not removeable. What u see is exactly what u get. I wud probly still order it, but if I had been counting on that, then it wudnt be good enuf, obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gardening when you can't stoop and kneel for long periods
customer_reviews.text: Having my hopper car to cruise down my gardening beds pulling weeds and aerating the soil has been wonderful! No more painful knees and hips. Rolls smoothly over grass, dirt, and concrete and is easy to move along in either direction and hold in place with my feet. Having a spot for a beverage (although must be pop-can size) is handy. The hopper came preassembled which was nice too. Glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: LindyLouTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: This mobile bench is low enough to the ground to easily work while seated, yet high enough to get up and down easily. Holds my small tools underneath. Light enough to easily carry via the slot in the seat. Rolls easily. The cup holder will not secure my water bottle without it falling out, but this is not a deal breaker for me. I'm super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little garden seat.
customer_reviews.text: This garden seat works so well for me. I can sit sideways on it when that is best or straddle it in other situations. I can put my tools under the seat, or my cell phone. When I need to move down the row, I don't have to get up, just scoot . How helpful! The height is just right for me. I would recommend it to anyone. I would like to have one in the garden for weeding and picking beans, and one at the house for weeding and working in the flower beds.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hoffert

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this. She really likes the fact that the seat is plastic. the hot sun here in Florida heats up the metal seat she tried before. recommend this one Plus it has the handy compartment under the seat to keep the garden tools.
customer_reviews.author: Daver

customer_reviews.title: Used indoors to clean inside tile grout - quite sturdy. Will also use outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Used indoors to clean inside tile grout - quite sturdy. Will also use outdoors. Too bad manufacturer didnt incorporate wheel locks so it could be used as a stepping stool (?) I would recommend. It came intact and fast! Pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lo

customer_reviews.title: Must have gardening aide
customer_reviews.text: I have found the Garden Hopper to be a must have for gardening. It is easy to roll around on or pick up and move. The under seat area is large enough for several tools and other supplies. I have been very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bear One

customer_reviews.title: Perfect yard caddy - durable
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight, has a cup holder and instead of stooping over, you can sit in comfort while planting, pulling weeds, doing whatever you once did crouched over! Holds most anything you need for those kinds of tasks, and did I mention it has a cup holder?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart
customer_reviews.text: As for maneuvering, it goes forward and back very smoothly it does not turn. It's very sturdy, I weight 300 lbs and it is great. Plus my 21 month granddaughter loves to put her stuffed animals inside and take them for rides. The cupholder is perfect for her sippy cup too....
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Saved Babysitting Grandma's knees!
customer_reviews.text: As a full time Grandma Babysitter I'm always crawling around on floor with the kids. Unfortunately, my knees were taking a toll. Thanks to the Garden Hopper, I've been able to be at my Grandkids level. No more kneeling! At 5'8" & 170# the Hopper & I get along beautifully. In fact, I've even "ridden it" to "race around" as the kids ride on their toddler scooters!! Have enjoyed for 6 months now with no issues. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: Great for Gardening with Arthritis
customer_reviews.text: We have a large garden area and weeding has become a real chore since I have severe arthritis in one knee. This handy little stool with wheels makes weeding much easier. The Garden Hopper is so sturdy that we find ourselves abusing it. It has held as much as 200 pounds, was repeatedly left out in the rain, was used to give children rides and has had tree limbs fall on it. You probably should not use the Garden Hopper in this way, but we have and it still looks and performs as well as it did the first day. We just hose it down when it gets dirty.
customer_reviews.author: GrannyK

customer_reviews.title: Great Hopper
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that I could sit on to water and weed and plant with and I am glad I chose this garden hopper.You can carry it to where you want is holds a drink and the storage for garden tools under the seat is great.It holds glove,and all your gardening supplies.It is just the right height.No assembly what so ever just take it out of the box and it is good to go.Cleans with a hose or by hand ,Rolls very easily. I think it is a bit pricey but still considering there is nothing to be done it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ilane I. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Make gardening easier !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for working in the flower beds. Rolls nice and storage underneath. Makes it easy for an old lady to weed her garden !!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Little

customer_reviews.title: NO turns in the garden, not so helpful if you have plant boxes to go around.
customer_reviews.text: very small. impossible to turn while sitting. only suitable for going straight ahead. if you want to turn, you must stand up and point it the way you need to go.. I have trouble standing up from this little guy. hard plastic, no-swivel seat. .. small wheels, its hard to roll thru lawn. The grass between my garden boxes is not very smooth, however. very low to ground.
customer_reviews.author: Burvent

customer_reviews.title: Right height for gardening or painting
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect cart for anybody over age 40 who needs to do gardening or painting work. It allows you to pull weeds or plant while seated. It is also very useful for painting baseboards. Open area under the seat can hold gloves and tools.
customer_reviews.author: J. V.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this little cart
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little cart. It is a good height from the ground, rolls easily, feels very sturdy and has a perfect little place for my hand tools. Would buy it again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee A Snow

customer_reviews.title: It is not comfortable for sitting.  The seat is really hard.
customer_reviews.text: I have two older Step2 Garden Hoppers that I love, but ordered this newer version because it looked taller, but the seat is really hard plastic & heavier to carry to the garden. I would like to return it. Have only tried it out in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie Woodfin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product I'd purchase again if need be.
customer_reviews.text: Love the sturdy build an usefulness of this cart. I am not fond of the wheels but I am very heavy more than what the product is weighted for, still is an awesome product. I'd buy it again if needed. Ps. the color is more olive green than dark green. Perfect garden helper especially if you can't sit on your knees in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Not good for mobility impaired
customer_reviews.text: Good for going side to side, but wheels don't swivel at all. Bought it for my 85 year old Mother who had a very time getting back up once she was sitting on the wagon. Had to roll on to the ground to get up. She also fell backwards and hit her head one time. I now have it, and it's good for painting low surfaces, and gardening.
customer_reviews.author: BJeff

customer_reviews.title: sit and weed
customer_reviews.text: It came out of the box...all put together! I can sit and weed my flower beds and it is so much easier than trying to get off the ground. I can sit on it and roll a little at a time. Put my drink in the cup holder and reach below for the tool I need without having to crawl back where I left it. Just a clever idea. It works good for us retired folks that have a hard time getting up and down anymore. I do not bend as well either.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Great little garden helper
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for a new gardener. One of the better items for garden tool storage. Love the seat and with the handle it'll be easy to carry. Love that it has wheels so I don't have to get up and move everything to the next spot, just roll!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: Best gardening seat made in my opinion!!! So much so that I have two and send to friends. They roll over any surface. My gf didn’t think she’d like it because of her terrain... she LOVES IT Just do not leave them out in the rain long term
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: my garden buddy
customer_reviews.text: My son got me this because I love gardening but have a bad back. I love this little buddy. customer_reviews.title: Nice little plastic go cart

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product

customer_reviews.title: If you're over 200 lbs look elsewhere

customer_reviews.title: Garden hopper

customer_reviews.title: Love it!

Only concern is that my 5 yr. old grandson will probably want one of his own. If it encourages him to work in the garden, I may get him one. One caveat....if you are a big guy or gal, it might be too lightweight. I weigh 135 and it is more than substantial enough for me.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, especially if you have bad back problems

The storage area is very useful too. I used to put my smokes in there before I quit..and also my cell phone, in addition to garden tools and bottled water.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect...needs some tweaking
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and portability. Good seat height and comfortable seat size, and the wide wheels let you push yourself along easily. However, the seat surface is smooth and slippery and even slight inclines found me having to constantly reseat myself. Also, the handy carrying slot on the seat lets water in, but the solid bottom of the cart doesn't let it out. I would like to suggest to the manufacturer to put a non-slip coating on the seat, and several drainage holes in the bottom. Then it would be perfect. If I were to recommend this product to a friend I would have to include those two caveats.

product_meta.title: Step2 534800 Garden Hopper, 1, Green and Tan
product_meta.description:
The Garden Hopper work seat has 7" smooth rolling wheels for easy mobility on grass. The Garden Hopper features a molded-in seat handle for easy transport, a large storage shelf for tools and gloves and a beverage holder. The sturdy double-wall construction will last for years.

AMAZON.COM
As any gardener knows, even the best-laid plans for spending a day with the soil can be ruined by the necessity for repeated trips to the house or shed for the proper equipment. With the Step 2 Garden Hopper, however, it's possible to pack everything you need for a full day's gardening and take it all wherever you go. The Garden Hopper features an extremely sturdy seat that's just high enough to offer a comfortable perch yet low enough to keep you close to your garden. While a molded carrying handle is included within the seat itself, the Hopper's 7-inch wheels make it simple to scoot about without rising. With its sturdy double-wall construction, the Garden Hopper is strong enough to take a lot of rugged treatment. Beneath the seat is a large storage space, perfect for holding your gloves, tools, seeds, cellular phone, and other accessories you may need. In addition, this handy garden helper includes a built-in holder for a 12-ounce beverage, eliminating the need to run back into the house for refreshment. The Garden Hopper measures about 14 inches tall, 12.5 inches wide, and about 22 inches long. --Benjamin Reese
